scenarioDescription:
The HD 132563 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 132563 is a star with 1.23 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.3 times its radius. It is located 342.97 light years away from the solar system.

HD 132563 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 132563 system


HD 132563 b

HD 132563 b was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory observatory, in 2011-09, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.62 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 132563 b is 473.820 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 132563 b is 13.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 132563 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 132563, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory.
name: HD 132563 - System With 1 Exoplanet
